item.title: [tut] php
item.dc:creator: @Cabby Cabby
item.description:
@Cabby wrote:

[center][size=15pt][/size]!MORE TO COME![/center]

What PHP Stands For: PHP: Hypertext Preprocessor.

When I get update this again I’ll add in how to make your own PHP script!

Displaying the date in a HTML page:

<html>
<head>
</head>
<? print(Date("l F d, Y")); ?>

<body>
</body>
</html>

You don’t really have to edit anything here, It checks the date and it displays it.

Display a random # between two #:

<?
srand(time());
$random = (rand()%j10);
print("$random is A random # between your two numbers 1-10");
?>

Well, To change what number you want to find a random number between, change where it says “(rand()%j10);” Change the 10 to any number.
Also change where it says “print(”$random is A random # between your two numbers 1-10");" Change the 10 to whatever # you put above.

Different Capitilizations:

<?
print(strtoupper("moparisthebest.com --all should be capital.<br>"));
print(strtolower("MOPARISTHEBEST.COM --SHOULD ALL BE LOWERCASE!<br>"));
print(ucfirst("moparisthebest.com --the first word should start with a capital letter.<br>"));
print(ucwords("moparisthebest.com --the first letter of each word should be capital.<br>"));
?>

OK, you can just change the text anything. Or you can simply take one out of the code.

Search a certain URL:

<html>
<body>
<?
$size = 0;
$url = "http://www.moparisthebest.com";
$the_page = fopen($url, "r");
while(!feof($the_page))
{
  $each_line = fgetss($the_page, 255);
    if(eregi($search_criteria, $each_line, $results))
   {
      $size++;
   }
}
fclose($the_page);
print("I found $size ocurrences of $search_criteria at $url");
?>
</body>
</html>

All you have to do is change the URL at the beginning, Thats the URL that the code will search in.

[size=13pt]DON’T WORRY, THERE WILL BE MORE! I’M SORRY![/size]

Read full topic
